info: Shota Aizawa, also known as Eraser Head, is an esteemed faculty member at U.A. High School and home room teacher of Class 1A.
teacherinfo: Specializing in hero education Aizawa is able to hone in multiple aspects of the students in order to make them the best professional Hero they can be. In order to save lives they must be able to protect their own and Aizawa's Quirk, Erasure, allows him to nullify the Quirks of his opponents and his students. This unique ability allows the students to gain an understanding of skills when working with different and unique quirks in opponents. While Aizawa is known for his practical and no-nonsense teaching style, He focuses on preparing students for the challenges they will face in the field, emphasizing the importance of adaptability and quick decision-making. His emphasis on real-world application ensures that students are well-equipped for the dynamic and unpredictable nature of hero work to ensure their survival and to save lives.  He encourages a strong work ethic, fostering a mindset of continuous improvement. His commitment to pushing students to their limits contributes to the development of resilient and capable heroes. Despite his stern exterior, Aizawa genuinely cares about the well-being of his students. He provides guidance and support, helping them navigate the challenges of hero training and personal growth and his mentorship extends beyond the classroom, creating a supportive environment for students to thrive.

info: All Might is known as the Symbol Of Peace within our world due to the amount of crime he stops and the amount of lives he saves.
teacherinfo: Having All Might as a teacher at U.A. High School is an unparalleled opportunity for students aspiring to become heroes. As the Symbol of Peace and the former number one hero, All Might brings an unmatched level of experience, wisdom, and inspiration to the classroom. All Might's teaching style is dynamic, blending practical hero training with profound insights gained from years of battling villains. He instills not only the importance of strength but also the values of courage, compassion, and responsibility in his students. All Might's iconic status makes him an influential mentor, guiding students toward reaching their full potential. His personal journey from a quirkless individual to the Symbol of Peace offers invaluable lessons on resilience and determination.

info: Nezu is the Principal of UA. With his intellectual abilities he has created the perfect home for fostering the young students.
teacherinfo: Principal Nezu of U.A. High School is an extraordinary leader in the realm of hero education. With a keen intellect and a commitment to nurturing the potential of every student, Principal Nezu has created an environment that fosters both academic excellence and practical hero skills. Known for his strategic thinking and a deep understanding of the challenges heroes face, Principal Nezu ensures that U.A. remains at the forefront of hero education. His approachability and genuine concern for students make him a respected and beloved figure on campus. Under Principal Nezu's guidance, U.A. High School continues to produce top-tier heroes, and his visionary leadership contributes significantly to the school's stellar reputation

info: Nejire Hado is a top student within the Heroics program
teacherinfo: Nejire is cheerful, outgoing, and has an enthusiastic personality. She is often portrayed as friendly and approachable. Nejire helps train the new students and mentors them to be the best they can be. She also ensures that they are fit for the heroics program.

info: Mirio also known as Lemilion is a top student within the Heroics program
teacherinfo: Mirio is known for his optimistic and energetic personality. He maintains a positive outlook even in challenging situations. With his energy and willingness he pushes new students to be the best they can and challenge them with a unique quirk. Mirio also helps mentor the new students and ensure they are mentally and emotionally ready for the upcoming training

info: Tamaki also known as SunEater is a top student within the Heroics program
teacherinfo: Tamaki is more introverted and reserved. Despite his shyness, he possesses a strong sense of responsibility and loyalty to his friends. With this reserveness he helps protect the new students and ensure they are physically able to meet the challenge.

info: Present Mic, also known as Hizashi Yamada, is a vibrant and dynamic faculty member at U.A. High School.
teacherinfo: Present Mic's exuberance and passion for heroism are contagious. His enthusiasm for the hero profession motivates students to approach their training with energy and dedication.  He brings a lively and engaging teaching style that fosters a sense of excitement in the classroom. With his Quirk, Voice, Present Mic has exceptional vocal abilities. This not only adds a unique dimension to his teaching style but also underscores the importance of effective communication in hero work. Students have the opportunity to learn how to command attention and communicate clearly, crucial skills for any aspiring hero.  Present Mic's experience as a professional hero gives him valuable insights into the challenges and responsibilities that heroes face in the field. He shares real-world anecdotes and scenarios, providing students with a practical understanding of heroism beyond the classroom. Known for his approachable and friendly nature, Present Mic establishes strong connections with his students. This fosters a positive and supportive learning environment. He takes an interest in each student's growth, offering guidance and mentorship throughout their academic journey.In summary, having Present Mic as a teacher at U.A. High School brings a dynamic and interactive dimension to hero education. His passion, communication skills, real-world experience, and commitment to student development make him an invaluable asset in shaping the next generation of heroes. Joining his class promises an exciting and enriching educational experience at U.A. High School.

info: Introducing Midnight, one of the distinguished faculty members at U.A. High School, renowned for her expertise in hero education and unique contributions to the academy.
teacherinfo: Midnight is a seasoned hero with a profound understanding of combat techniques and tactical strategies. Her experience in facing various villains brings a practical and real-world perspective to her teachings. With her Quirk, Somnambulist, Midnight can release a sleep-inducing fragrance, providing a strategic advantage in both offensive and defensive scenarios. Students have the opportunity to learn from her mastery of Quirk application, gaining insights into how to effectively utilize their own abilities. Midnight's passion for heroism is contagious, inspiring students to approach their training with enthusiasm and dedication. She emphasizes not just the physical aspects of being a hero but also the importance of charisma, presence, and quick thinking. Known for her approachable demeanor and genuine concern for her students, Midnight provides a supportive learning environment. She encourages students to embrace their individual strengths and quirks, fostering a sense of self-confidence among the aspiring heroes.

info: Cementoss, also known as Ken Ishiyama, is a prominent faculty member at U.A. High School, specializing in hero education.
teacherinfo: Cementoss possesses a formidable Quirk called Cement. This allows him to manipulate cement at will, providing a unique skill set that is both defensive and versatile. Students have the opportunity to learn from his mastery of Quirk application, gaining insights into effective combat strategies and rescue operations. With his Quirk, Cementoss has a deep understanding of structural elements, making him an expert in both offense and defense. He imparts this knowledge to students, emphasizing the importance of environmental awareness in hero work.His teachings extend beyond the physical aspects, incorporating strategic thinking and adaptability.Cementoss is known for his disciplined and organized approach to hero training. He instills a sense of order and responsibility in his students, preparing them for the challenges they may face as professional heroes. Students benefit from a structured learning environment that promotes focus, dedication, and teamwork. Cementoss's Quirk provides a stable and reliable foundation, reflecting his commitment to the safety and well-being of his students. As a mentor, he offers steady guidance and support, ensuring that students feel secure as they navigate their hero education journey. In summary, having Cementoss as a teacher at U.A. High School offers students a comprehensive education in both the practical and strategic aspects of heroism. His expertise, discipline, and commitment to a safe and structured learning environment contribute significantly to the holistic development of aspiring heroes. Joining his class promises a solid foundation for success in the dynamic world of hero work at U.A. High School.

info: Recovery Girl, also known as Chiyo Shuzenji, is an invaluable member of the U.A. High School faculty, specializing in the critical field of medical support for aspiring heroes
teacherinfo: Recovery Girl is a highly skilled and experienced medical professional. Her Quirk, Heal, allows her to accelerate the natural healing process in individuals, making her an indispensable asset in the world of heroism.Students benefit from her extensive knowledge of injuries and medical emergencies, ensuring they receive top-notch care and guidance during their hero training. Recovery Girl's quick thinking and ability to provide immediate medical attention make her an essential component of U.A.'s commitment to the safety and well-being of its students. She imparts crucial skills to students, teaching them how to respond to emergencies and prioritize the health and safety of themselves and others during hero missions. Despite her no-nonsense approach, Recovery Girl genuinely cares about the students under her care. She provides emotional support and guidance, understanding the unique challenges that come with the demanding life of a hero-in-training. Her nurturing presence helps create a supportive environment where students can focus on their studies and training with confidence. Recovery Girl emphasizes the importance of holistic well-being, teaching students not only how to recover from physical injuries but also how to maintain mental and emotional resilience in the face of the challenges they may encounter. Her approach contributes to the development of well-rounded heroes who prioritize both their physical and mental health. In summary, having Recovery Girl as part of the U.A. High School faculty ensures that students receive exceptional medical care, emergency response training, and the compassionate support needed for their overall well-being.

info: Thirteen, also known as the Space Hero: Thirteen, is an esteemed member of the U.A. High School faculty, specializing in disaster response and rescue operations.
teacherinfo: Thirteen brings a vast amount of knowledge and experience in disaster response and rescue operations. Her Quirk, Black Hole, allows for the creation of spatial warps, making them adept at handling various crisis situations. Students benefit from Thirteen's expertise, learning essential skills in disaster management and rescue techniques that are critical for hero work. Thirteen places a strong emphasis on safety and proper training. Her commitment to preparing students for the challenges of real-world heroism ensures that U.A. graduates are well-equipped to handle emergencies responsibly and effectively. Thirteen's dedication to creating a secure learning environment contributes to the overall well-being of students. Thirteen fosters a collaborative and team-oriented approach to hero training. Students learn the importance of working together in high-stakes situations, reinforcing the idea that heroism often requires effective teamwork. Thirteen's emphasis on cooperation contributes to the development of heroes who can seamlessly collaborate for the greater good. Thirteen's presence serves as an inspiration for aspiring heroes. Their calm and composed demeanor in the face of danger sets a positive example for students, instilling confidence and resilience. Students in Thirteen's class have the opportunity to witness firsthand the qualities that make a hero truly exceptional. In summary, having Thirteen as a teacher at U.A. High School provides students with a unique and comprehensive education in disaster response and rescue operations. Her expertise, commitment to safety, emphasis on teamwork, and inspirational presence contribute significantly to the holistic development of future heroes. Joining Thirteen's class at U.A. High School ensures a well-rounded education that prepares students for the challenges of heroism in a variety of scenarios.
